intro: Acetosella caledonica, commonly known as the Scottish spring beauty, is a small perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Scotland and northern England. It belongs to the Pink family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded woodland environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pinkish-white with five petals. Acetosella caledonica is a rare and protected species, often found in specific microhabitats that support its unique ecological requirements.
